text: <Þuncheþ> þet þu <hire>.

Get sæiþ þeo sowle soriliche to þen licame, ne <þearft> þu on stirope stonden mid fotan, on nenne goldfohne bowe, for þu <scalt> faren al to howe, ond þu scalt nu ruglunge ridæn to þære eorþe, <utset> æt þære dure, ne þearft þu næffre ongean cumæn, reowliche riden, <seoruliche> beræfed at þene eorþliche weole, þe þu iwold ohtest.
Nu mon mæi <seggen> bi þe, þes mon is iwiten nu her, weila, ond his weolæn beoþ her belæfed.
<Nolde> he nefre þærof don his drihtenes wille.
Ac æfre þu gæderedest gærsume <on> þine feonde.
Nulleþ heo nimen gete, hwo hit bigete.
Nafst þu bute <weilawei> þet þu weole heuedest.
Al is reowliche þin siþ efter þin wrecche <lif>.
Þeo men beoþ þe bliþre, þe arisen ær wiþ þe, þet þin muþ is betuned, þe <þu> þeo teone ut lettest, þe heom sore grulde, þet ham gros þe agan.
<Deaþ> hine haueþ bituned ond þene teone aleid.
Soþ is iseid on þen salmebec,Os tuum habundauit malitia, was on þine muþe luþernesse ripe.
<Noldest> þu on þine huse herborwen þeo wrecchen, ne mihten heo under <þine> roue none reste finden.
Noldest þu nefre helpen þam orlease <wrecchen>, ac þu sete on þine benche, underleid mid þine bolstre, þu wurpe <cneow> ofer cneow.
Ne icneowe þu þe sulfen, þet þu scoldest mid wurmen <wunien> in eorþan.
Nu þu hauest neowe hus, inne beþrungen, lowe beoþ þe <helewowes>, unheige beoþ þe sidwowes, þin rof liiþ on þine breoste ful <neih>.
Colde is þe ibedded, cloþes bideled.
Nulleþ þine hinen cloþes þe <senden>, for heom þuncheþ al to lut, þet þu heom bilefdest; þet þu hefdest <onhorded>, hit wulleþ heldan.
Þus is iwitan þin weole, wendest þet hit þin were.
Þus <is> nu þin siþ efter þin wrecche lif.
Þe sculen nu waxen wurmes be siden, <þeo> hungrie feond, þeo þe freten wulleþ.
Heo wulleþ þe frecliche freten, for <heom> þin flæsc likeþ.
Heo wulleþ freten þin fule hold, þeo hwule heo hit <findeþ>.
Þonne hit al biþ agon, heo wulleþ gnawen þine bon, þeo orlease <wurmes>.
Heo windeþ on þin armes, heo brekeþ þine breoste ond borieþ þurh ofer al.
<Heo> reoweþ in ond ut, þet hord is hore owen.
Ond so heo wulleþ waden wide in þine <wombe>, todelen þine þermes, þeo þe deore weren, lifre ond þine lihte <lodliche> torenden.
Ond so scal formelten mawe ond þin milte, ond so scal <þin>.
